com.admios.connector.watsonalchemylanguage

Class WatsonAlchemyLanguageConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.admios.connector.watsonalchemylanguage.WatsonAlchemyLanguageConnector

  • @RequiresEnterpriseLicense(allowEval=true)
@Connector(name="watson-alchemy-language",
           friendlyName="Watson AlchemyLanguage Service",
           minMuleVersion="3.6.0")
public class WatsonAlchemyLanguageConnector
extends Object
    The IBM Watsonâ„¢ AlchemyLanguage service is a collection of text analysis functions that derive semantic information from your content. You can input text, HTML, or a public URL and leverage sophisticated natural language processing techniques to get a quick high-level understanding of your content and obtain detailed insights such as sentiment for detected entities and keywords.
    Author:
    Admios

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.alchemy.v1.model.DocumentAuthors authors(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                                String source)
        Get author names from a webpage or HTML content. API Doc: http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/alchemy-language/api/v1/#authors
        Parameters:
        source - The HTML or url to process
        Returns:
        return A list of extracted DocumentAuthors

      • entities

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.alchemy.v1.model.Entities entities(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                          String source,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer maxRetrieve,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer coreference,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer disambiguate,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer knowledgeGraph,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer linkedData,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer quotations,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer sentiment,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Boolean showSourceText,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer structuredEntities,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          String cquery,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          String xpath,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          String sourceText)
        Extract entities from a text or a webpage. API Doc: http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/alchemy-language/api/v1/#entities
        Parameters:
        source - The text or url to process
        maxRetrieve - Maximum number of entities to return (default = 50)
        coreference - Set this to 0 to treat coreferences as separate entities (coreferences are resolved into detected entities by default)
        disambiguate - Set this to 0 to hide entity disambiguation information in the response
        knowledgeGraph - Set this to 1 to include knowledge graph information in the results. This incurs an additional transaction charge
        linkedData - Set this to 0 to hide Linked Data content links in the response
        quotations - Set this to 1 to include quotations that are linked to detected entities
        sentiment - Set this to 1 to analyze the sentiment towards each detected entity. This incurs an additional transaction charge
        showSourceText - Check this to include the source text in the response
        structuredEntities - Set this to 0 to ignore structured entities, such as Quantity, EmailAddress, TwitterHandle, Hashtag, and IPAddress
        cquery - A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery
        xpath - An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values
        sourceText - How to obtain the source text from the webpage
        Returns:
        return Entities

      • dateExtraction

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.alchemy.v1.model.Dates dateExtraction(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                             String source,
                                                                             @Optional
                                                                             String anchorDate,
                                                                             @Optional
                                                                             Boolean showSourceText)
        Extract Dates from a text, webpage or content in an url. API Doc: http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/alchemy-language/api/v1/#date-extraction
        Parameters:
        source - The text, html or url to process.
        anchorDate - The date to use as "today" when interpreting phrases in the text like "next tuesday." Format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss
        showSourceText - Check this to include the source text in the response.
        Returns:
        return Dates

      • concepts

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.alchemy.v1.model.Concepts concepts(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                          String source,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer maxRetrieve,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer knowledgeGraph,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Integer linkedData,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          Boolean showSourceText,

                                                                          String cquery,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          String xpath,
                                                                          @Optional
                                                                          String sourceText)
        Extract concepts from a webpage or plain text. API Doc: http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/alchemy-language/api/v1/#concepts
        Parameters:
        source - The text or url to process
        maxRetrieve - Maximum number of entities to return (default = 50) detected entities by default)
        knowledgeGraph - Set this to 1 to include knowledge graph information in the results. This incurs an additional transaction charge
        linkedData - Set this to 0 to hide Linked Data content links in the response
        showSourceText - Check this to include the source text in the response TwitterHandle, Hashtag, and IPAddress
        cquery - A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery
        xpath - An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values
        sourceText - How to obtain the source text from the webpage
        Returns:
        return Concepts

      • targetedSentiment

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.alchemy.v1.model.DocumentSentiment targetedSentiment(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                                            String source,
                                                                                            String target,
                                                                                            @Optional
                                                                                            Boolean showSourceText,
                                                                                            @Optional
                                                                                            String cquery,
                                                                                            @Optional
                                                                                            String xpath,
                                                                                            @Optional
                                                                                            String sourceText)
        Analyze sentiment for targeted phrases in a webpage, HTML, or plain text. Supported languages: Arabic, English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish. API Doc: http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/alchemy-language/api/v1/#targeted-sentiment
        Parameters:
        source - The text, HTML or URL to process.
        target - Target phrase. The service will return sentiment information for the phrase that is found in the source text.
        target - Target phrase. The service will return sentiment information for the phrase that is found in the source text.
        showSourceText - Check this to include the source text in the response.
        cquery - A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery.
        xpath - An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values.
        sourceText - How to obtain the source text from the webpage.
        Returns:
        return DocumentSentiment

      • relations

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.alchemy.v1.model.SAORelations relations(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                               String source,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Integer maxRetrieve,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Boolean showSourceText,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Boolean keywords,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Boolean entities,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Boolean requireEntities,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Boolean coreference,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Boolean disambiguate,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Boolean knowledgeGraph,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Boolean hideLinkedData,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               Boolean analyzeSentiment,
                                                                               @Optional@FriendlyName(value="Exclude entity from analysis")
                                                                               Boolean excludeEntityFromSentimentAnalysis,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               String cquery,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               String xpath,
                                                                               @Optional
                                                                               String sourceText)
        Extract Subject-Action-Object relations from a webpage, HTML, or plain text. Supported languages: English, Spanish API Doc: http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/alchemy-language/api/v1/#microformats
        Parameters:
        source - One of these is required. Pass HTML content in html, a public facing URL in url, or plain text in text.
        maxRetrieve - Maximum number of relations to return (default = 50, maximum = 100)
        showSourceText - Check this to include the source text in the response.
        keywords - Check this to identify keywords in detected relations. This incurs an additional transaction charge
        entities - Check this to identify named entities in detected relations. This incurs an additional transaction charge.
        requireEntities - Check this to restrict results to relations that contain at least one named entity.
        coreference - Check this treat coreferences as separate entities (coreferences are resolved into detected entities by default).
        disambiguate - Check this to hide entity disambiguation information in the response.
        knowledgeGraph - Check this to include knowledge graph information in the results. This incurs an additional transaction charge.
        hideLinkedData - Check this to hide Linked Data contents links in the response.
        analyzeSentiment - Check this to analyze the sentiment towards each result.
        excludeEntityFromSentimentAnalysis - Check this to exclude named entity text from sentiment analysis. For exapmle, do not analyze "New" in "New York".
        showSourceTex - Check this to include the source text in the response.
        cquery - A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery.
        xpath - An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values.
        sourceText - How to obtain the source text from the web page.
        Returns:
        return an array of detected relations.

      • textExtraction

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.alchemy.v1.model.DocumentText textExtraction(String source,
                                                                                    @Optional
                                                                                    String cquery,
                                                                                    @Optional
                                                                                    String xpath,
                                                                                    @Optional
                                                                                    String sourceText,
                                                                                    @Optional
                                                                                    String extractLinks,
                                                                                    @Optional
                                                                                    String useMetaData)
        Extract the main body text from a webpage or HTML. API Doc: https://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/alchemy-language/api/v1/#text_cleaned
        Parameters:
        source - The HTML or URL to process.
        cquery - A visual constraint query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery
        xpath - An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values
        sourceText - Determines how to obtain the source text from the webpage
        extractLinks - Set this to 1 to include hyperlinks in the extracted text
        useMetadata - Set this to 0 to ignore description information in webpage metadata
        useMetaData - Comment for useMetaData
        Returns:
        return DocumentText

      • combinedCall

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.alchemy.v1.model.CombinedResults combinedCall(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                                     String source,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     String extract,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Integer maxRetrieve,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Boolean keywords,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Boolean entities,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Boolean requireEntities,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Integer coreference,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Integer disambiguate,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Integer knowledgeGraph,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Integer linkedData,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Integer quotations,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Integer sentiment,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Boolean showSourceText,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     Integer structuredEntities,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     String anchorDate,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     String cquery,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     String xpath,
                                                                                     @Optional
                                                                                     String sourceText)
        Analyze text, HTML, or webpage content with multiple text analysis operations. Any parameters for the extract methods can also be passed. API Doc: http://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/alchemy-language/api/v1/#combined-call
        Parameters:
        source - The text or url to process
        extract - Comma separated list of any of the following methods: authors, concepts (default), dates, doc-emotion, entities (default), feeds, keywords (default), pub-date, relations, typed-rels, doc-sentiment, taxonomy (default), title
        maxRetrieve - Maximum number of entities to return (default = 50)
        anchorDate - The date to use as "today" when interpreting phrases in the text like "next tuesday.". Format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss
        keywords - Check this to identify keywords in detected relations. This incurs an additional transaction charge
        entities - Check this to identify named entities in detected relations. This incurs an additional transaction charge.
        requireEntities - Check this to restrict results to relations that contain at least one named entity.
        coreference - Set this to 0 to treat coreferences as separate entities (coreferences are resolved into detected entities by default)
        disambiguate - Set this to 0 to hide entity disambiguation information in the response
        knowledgeGraph - Set this to 1 to include knowledge graph information in the results. This incurs an additional transaction charge
        linkedData - Set this to 0 to hide Linked Data content links in the response
        quotations - Set this to 1 to include quotations that are linked to detected entities
        sentiment - Set this to 1 to analyze the sentiment towards each detected entity. This incurs an additional transaction charge
        showSourceText - Set this to 1 to include the source text in the response
        structuredEntities - Set this to 0 to ignore structured entities, such as Quantity, EmailAddress, TwitterHandle, Hashtag, and IPAddress
        cquery - A visual constraints query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to cquery
        xpath - An XPath query to apply to the web page. Required when sourceText is set to one of the XPath values
        sourceText - How to obtain the source text from the webpage
        Returns:
        return CombinedResults
